thread.title: How Your Snot Works and Why It Turns Green When You're Sick
thread.title_full: How Your Snot Works and Why It Turns Green When You're Sick

author: Beth Skwarecki
title: How Your Snot Works and Why It Turns Green When You're Sick
text:
Go to permalink 
We take our snot for granted, but it’s actually a really important substance that keeps our noses (and lungs, and even our digestive system!) working smoothly. This video gives the lowdown on those occasionally green blobs 
The color of snot varies, turning green when we’re sick because of a greenish enzyme called myeloperoxidase. And it gets thicker because it’s full of living and dead immune cells. Check out the video for more facts about this slimy substance.
